definition: debt of gratitude
man/person/people/CL:個|个[ge4],位[wei4]
feeling/emotion/passion/situation
debt/CL:筆|笔[bi3]

sentences.english: I was in my parents' debt.
sentences.chinese: 我欠下了我父母的人情債。

sentences.english: I'm only paying back on old debt of thankfulness.
sentences.chinese: 我覺得我只是在償還這份舊時的人情債。

sentences.english: I owe a debt of gratitude to you.
sentences.chinese: 對你所做的事，我欠你壹份人情債。

sentences.english: How do you repay "debt of gratitude"?
sentences.chinese: 生活中的“人情債”該如何償還？

sentences.english: I feel a special debt of gratitude to him.
sentences.chinese: 又是指我對他特別感恩或欠他一筆人情債。

sentences.english: I owe him a debt of gratitude for all he has done for me.
sentences.chinese: 我欠他一筆人情債，因爲他曾幫過我的忙。

definition: to bring trouble on oneself (idiom)
lit. to work like an ox, to work like a horse; fig. to work extremely hard
lit. small belly, chicken's gut (idiom); narrow-minded/petty
spendthrift and foolish/sb with more money than sense
to refute/to demolish (an argument, theory etc)
lit. either the fish dies or the net splits/a life and death struggle (idiom)
to have boundless prospects
to quit while one is ahead (idiom)/to know when to stop
riffraff/scum/lowlife/despicable/inferior
lit. drinking poison in the hope of quenching one's thirst (idiom)/fig. a supposed remedy that only makes matters worse
using a wicker basket to draw water (idiom); wasted effort
traitor to one's love/heartless rat
to patch up one's lie (when inconsistencies appear)/to cover (for sb who has lied)
to extort under false pretenses/to blackmail/to bluff/to defraud
keenly felt pain/bitter anguish
open the net on one side (idiom); let the caged bird fly/to give one's opponent a way out/lenient treatment
